alert.note: Alert for Crowley County; La Junta Vicinity, Otero County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued August 25 at 2:26AM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM NOON MDT TODAY THROUGH LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...Pikes Peak, Teller County and the Rampart Range, Fremont County, the northern Sangre De Cristo and Wet Mountains, the Wet Mountain Valley and El Paso, Pueblo, Crowley and Otero counties. * WHEN...From Noon MDT today through late tonight. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Thunderstorms capable of producing intense rainfall rates will develop over the mountains and spread across portions of southern Colorado this afternoon and evening. Burn scars and urban areas will be most prone to flash flooding. However, flooding will also be possible where storms redevelop over or near steep terrain, or for locations that receive repeated rounds of heavy rainfall. - http://www.floodsafety.noaa.gov
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.

area.areaDesc: Crowley County; La Junta Vicinity, Otero County
